title: Need help!!
content:
Feeling like f*cked up in life , I'm a second year CSE student.
Having a CGPA  < 7 , Don't have any skills .
Cannot understand the classes and doing ntg just wasting time .
Feeling depressed , From a topper till PU to trying bloody hard just to pass the exams.
Always on the phone for the present dopamine.

Cannot getting what the f*ck I'm I doing in this bloody life.
As an introvert I didn't make many friends in first year , always being alone..

Can anyone please give me some suggestions to overcome here and pursue well in both academics , social life and etc...

Please give me some suggestions 😭😭

comments.body:
Why tf are you guys like this? Damn!! You guys are acting like there’s not a million other careers to choose from…… 


And btw CGPA of 7 isn’t as bad as you think… just have some good projects…..

ps : College is meant to be enjoyable not miserable🤦‍♂️

Aight dude.. GPA ain't the end of the world.. get your head out of the phone tho.. look around and try to connect with a few of your peers. Try doing some projects on your own.. look into the internet for actual teachers.. have fun while ur doing all this.. play some games and shit.. try joining some clubs and interacting there.. ur life ain't over just cause u have a bad gpa..
Bro, try making some friends. Being alone is contributing to your depression, and friends could help with it. This will allow you to focus on your studies.

I relate soo much to you!
As a person with a cgpa<7 and in second year rn, it does feel like everything’s gone downhill 
Never made friends, haven’t spoken to even a single person other than my roommate
It felt like hell, but eventually i got used to it, perhaps being alone didn’t feel lonely after a while
Anyways,we relate so much , in case you wanna be friends? hmu!

Don't do any shit(suicide) while you are in this phase 
Life is greater than gpa 🙏
Even I had nearly 7 in 2nd year but I grinded third year and got 9 both sems and able to sit for atleast half the placement exams and got T1 company don’t lose hope!

a lot of people are on the same boat dude 
i don’t think you should stress yourself a lot and start working on yourself 
you still have two more years
you’re still have the chance to get over 8 gpa if you work hard
but gpa is not the only criteria to succeed in  college
college life is amazing, you won’t get it ever 
so try joining clubs, make friends, go out
make the best out of it
and if you ever feel shitty in life, talk to somebody 
trust me life gets shittier after college
if i had a chance to go back in time, i’d go back to my college days
Definitely I'll use your suggestion thank you 🙂

As someone who’s passed out of PES and doing decently good at life. All of this shit doesn’t even matter in 6 months, no one’s going to ask your CGPA or who is the topper. All the toppers in my class got placed for tier 2/3 or either unemployed . Don’t chase marks, it doesn’t matter. 

Find what you would love to do in life, that’s what those 4 years are for. Try everything, see what you love to do in life and chase it. Marks cgpa Louda also won’t matter once you pass out

Leave the past. Don't compare the it with the present or future. Stay calm and try to make full use of the opportunities you have.
When you feel lonely, talk to someone. Listen to some nice music. It's soothing.
It's not easy to get into a good college. When you could make it, then you have something in your right. That feeling should boost your energy and get the best of you. You'll be fine, don't worry. Everything is temporary:)
Leave no matter what advice ppl give ppl like you won't learn
Really 🤣 , I'll prove you that you are wrong 👾
